LA fires: Expert warns climate change has ‘made it worse’, urges better planning for a warmer world - The Front Page https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/la-fires-expert-warns-climate-change-has-made-it-worse-urges-better-planning-for-a-warmer-world-the-首页/XLBF5GG2X5B7JCIF6I26J5LOD4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/la-fires-expert-warns-climate-change-has-made-it-worse-urges-better-planning-for-a-warmer-world-the-首页/XLBF5GG2X5B7JCIF6I26J5LOD4/ Chelsea DanielsFires are just the latest natural disaster the US has faced in recent years. Mon, 13 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000 A fire fighting helicopter drops water as the Palisades fire grows near the Mandeville Canyon neighborhood and Encino, California, on January 11, 2025. The Palisades Fire, the largest of the Los Angeles fires, spread toward previously untouched neighborhoods January 11, forcing new evacuations and dimming hopes that the disaster was coming under control. Across the city, at least 11 people have died as multiple fires have ripped through residential areas since January 7, razing thousands of homes in destruction that US President Joe Biden likened to a "war scene." (Photo by Patrick T. Fallon / AFP)
